This section contains setting details, characters, and Encounters which will help structure the game for you and your friends. These are only guides. The things that happen in your game may differ from the story outlined here. It is important to prioritize the fiction you create while playing over this campaign guide. Improvisation and character decisions are encouraged. Feel free to modify details found in this section to suit your needs.

Alternatively, you may want to create your own setting and storyline that is completely different from the campaign provided. That’s great! You can refer to the Episodes in this section to help you create Encounters or spark your imagination. Below are a few questions to help get you started when conceptualizing your own campaign. You may want to discuss these questions with the other players and build the setting together. Allowing everyone to contribute creates a sense of collective ownership and investment. Also, it’s fun!

Tone - How serious is the game? Will it be full of political intrigue and the harsh realities of war? Or will it focus on stopping a dastardly plot to steal the Statue of Liberty? Are mechs treading through war-torn jungles or striking poses as they soar through the air? Some players might enjoy playing out a scene of mech pilots checking into their hotel as a great way to humanize their characters and have realistic interactions with each other. Other players might find such a scene painfully boring. Establishing expectations about the tone will help everyone get on the same page right from the beginning.

Realism - Are there monster and aliens in this world? Magic? Is it set on another planet or a different plane of existence? Or is the world you play in exactly like the world we live in? The possibilities are limitless. You’ll want to make sure everyone understands how fantastical your fictional world is.

Technology - How advanced are the mechs and the world they live in? Do they work using steam and pistons? Or do pilots control them through brain implants? Do characters have access to long-range communication, the Internet, or possibly even teleportation? These factors can greatly impact game-play and establishing the level of technology available will affect player capabilities and decisions.

Scale - Are the mechs slightly bigger than humans or are they as large as the moon? What are the stakes of the character’s actions? Character motivations could revolve around personal matters or the fate of the world. The campaign could follow a ragtag mech squad as they advance through the countryside to blow up an energy turbine. Or players might be involved in an intergalactic space opera that spans multiple planets and alien kingdoms. Consider what is on the line if characters fail as it will greatly affect how they react emotionally to the situations they encounter.

Difficulty - This is ultimately something that you as the gam-emaster will have to tweak and experiment with as you play. Your group may enjoy the story and role-playing aspects of the game more than difficult tactical combat. Also, some of your previous decisions regarding Tone, Realism, and Scale will affect how difficult your battles should be. Players should always be challenged at certain points in the story. But barely scrapping through fights and occasionally needing to retreat is more appropriate for some stories than it is for others. Some players may be experiences war gamers while some may have hardly any game experience at all. Finding the right difficulty level for your play group will help reinforce the mood of the game and increase everyone’s enjoyment.

Characters in Beamswords and Bazookas play mech pilots in MASS, the Mobile Armor Support and Suppression unit of the Global Protectorate. This unit is a diverse group of pilots from around the globe who have dedicated themselves to a greater cause. In 2085, the MASS unit was the fighting force responsible for defeating the alien invasion. But now, in 2119, MASS’s  primary goal is protecting humanity from itself.

The Global Protectorate, or GP, is the international political force that unifies nations. During the alien invasion, the GP was vital in coordinating the resistance effort. In the years immediately after the invasion, the GP was largely supported as the governing body that would lead humanity into the future. Now many nations are experiencing a wave of nationalistic backlash as communities become fearful of losing their sovereignty to the world coalition. Local conflicts are erupting at an alarming rate and many fear what is to come.

The aliens that invaded Earth are still an enigma. They were giant monstrosities that towered over cities and could take down a skyscraper with one swipe of their talons. They were defeated by the brave mech pilots of MASS. But not before catastrophic damage was done to cities and communities across the globe. Nothing has been heard from this alien threat in decades. Scientists of the Global Protectorate are still working to crack the code of who they are, where they come from, and why they attacked.

The countries of the world have taken different shapes in the year 2119. Some have joined together to form coalitions while other nations have split. Individual Episodes provide more details on specific locales and government entities. Feel free to create your own fictitious future-nations and modify the details of the countries/locations as needed. Also, while this campaign encourages an international cast of characters, please use discretion when representing cultures that are not your own.

There is a refugee crisis in the small Thailand village of Wu-lai. Civilians are currently caught in the middle of an international conflict between the East Asian Confederacy (EAC) and the Thai government. The EAC has consolidated power across much of Asia through both peaceful alliances and strong-arm political tactics. However, Thailand has consistently opposed their influence. The EAC has invaded Thailand and the Thai army is struggling to hold them at bay. MASS pilots have been tasked with escorting a contingent of personnel carriers along the Nan River and coordinating with the Thai military in order to extract the refugees caught in the middle of the conflict. After landing in a remote airfield and trekking some distance along the Nan river, the Mass unit will be ambushed by an EAC scouting party.

River Ambush Mech Encounter - An enemy mech squadron lies in wait along a winding river. Low cliffs flank either side of the river and tree thickets are dispersed throughout. For a three player Encounter, field 1 Commando Mech, 1 Sniper Mech, 1 Strike Mech, and 3 Assault Mechs. For four players, add 5 Anti-Mech Infantry. For five players, add 1 Veteran Mech and 1 Assault Mech. For six players, add 5 Anti-Mech Infantry.

Commander Boon Nam of the Thailand army will arrive with a small squad of soldiers after the Encounter. Nam will thank the MASS pilots for defeating the scouting party they’ve had skirmishes with all week. Boon Nam has sunken eyes but a very serious face. His hair is shaved close and there’s a scar on his cheek. Nam will escort the MASS pilots to Wulai.

Wulai looks like it was a quiet town, but is currently overloaded with refugees and the Thai army. There’s a mechanics bay and a tent city set-up as a barracks on the outskirts of the city. An operational headquarters has been established in a former school. Boon Nam will guide players to the tent barracks and offer them rest while he prepares the refugees for immediate evacuation.

Traitor Search Character Encounter - After some time, Commander Boon Nam will gather the MASS pilots for a private meeting. Nam informs them that one of the transports has been sabotaged. Boon says that mechanics are working to repair the transport. But Nam suspects a traitor in Wulai. Boon cannot fully trust anyone in his command and asks that the MASS pilots look for any signs of an EAC spy while they are in the village.

There is still one bar open in Wulai. The owner introduces herself as Lina Huang to the MASS pilots. Lina is happy to have customers and reveals that she moved from China to Thailand to avoid the East Asian Confederacy once before. She says she has no intentions of leaving and starting over again. She has worked hard to establish this bar in Wulai and is extremely proud of it. Lina has no loyalties to the EAC, but will reveal that many refugees who are in the village were spared by EAC soldiers who had no interest in killing civilians.

Jean Imamu is an overworked doctor who came to Wulai with the Red Cross. He is attempting to treat the sick and injured refugees from a meager tent outside a temple. Jean is annoyed with anyone who tries to ask questions, but will ask for help in dealing with injured refugees. Jean has no allegiance to the EAC, but will reveal that many refugees came to Wulai specifically because word was sent out by the Thai army that it was a safe haven. He says it made a bad situation worse.

Aileen O’Sullivan is a photographer with the Associated Press. Her photos were responsible for the international attention given to the refugee crisis in Wulai and have led to MASS intervention. Aileen is a spy for the EAC and any attempts to figure this out will be a 3 difficulty. However, O’Sullivan’s intentions are to have the refugees removed from the city so that the EAC can assault it without civilian deaths. Aileen knows that Commander Boon Nam is using the refugees as a deterrent. She will hint that the chief mechanic in Wulai, Chati, acts as though he is deaf, but his hearing is actually perfect.

Chati So is the chief mechanic in charge of repairing the transports for the refugee extractions. The repair will never actually happen if Chati is left alone. Attempts to find signs of sabotage in the mechanics bay is a 2 difficulty task. Chati will pretend he can’t hear and only reads lips. He will get very flustered if caught lying. Chati sabotaged the transports and feels terrible about it. He was commanded to do it by Boon Nam.

Boon Nam believes that the defense of Wulai is the last chance to repel the EAC invasion. Nam says that MASS extracting the refugees will mean the death of his soldiers and the defeat of Thailand. Nam believes that if MASS would be willing to help fight the EAC, they can deal enough damage to push back the invasion. If players are willing to help Boon Nam, they’ll be tasked with the Airfield Assault Mech Encounter. If they are not willing to help and only want to get the refugees out alive, the Thai army will attempt to stop them and they will have to complete the City Escape Mech Encounter.

Airfield Assault Mech Encounter - MASS pilots are tasked with taking out the nearby supply depot for the EAC forward assault. The airfield has many planes and stores of equipment around it. Sandbag barricades have been erected in a defensive position in front of the airstrip itself. The terrain is fairly flat otherwise. For a three player Encounter, field 2 Defender Mechs, 5 Helicopters, and 4 Anti-Mech Infantry. For four players, add 1 Gunner Mech and 1 Bomber Mech. For five players, add 3 Helicopters and 2 Anti-Mech Infantry. And for 6 players, add 1 Gunner Mech and 1 Bomber Mech.

City Escape Mech Encounter - MASS pilots must defend 3 personnel transports as the Thai army attacks. The transports are being loaded in a public square surrounded by small building and a river to one side. Enemy combatants approach through the city proper.  For a three player Encounter, field 2 Combat Mechs, 2 Assault Mechs, 1 Veteran Mech, and 4 Anti-Mech Infantry. For four players, add 1 Combat Mech and 3 Anti-Mech Infantry. For five players, add 1 Assault Mech and 3 Anti-Mech Infantry. And for 6 players, add 1 Assault Mech and 1 Veteran Mech.
Episode 2: Sunset in the Southern Dominion

A warlord named Santino Romero has been moving from city to city in the Southern Dominion and forcing them into paying for protection. Going by the mech call sign Permanent Midnight, Santino has been unforgiving in the treatment of any who oppose him. Santino and his band of mech commandos pose a bigger threat than anyone in the region is equipped to handle. This situation is a humanitarian crisis MASS cannot ignore.

The Southern Dominion, formerly Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay, and Peru, has rejected all forms of centralized government. Much of the territory is run by local collectives and community leaders. The result is a generally peaceful and self-sustaining region. But the lack of a central government means that small militias are not always equipped to deal with bigger threats. Additionally, the people of the Southern Dominion are often highly hostile towards international powers and global involvement in the region. MASS pilots should assume they are in hostile territory at all times.

Santino Romero’s next target is suspected to be Salta, a high-altitude city in the Andes Mountains. MASS pilots should prioritize the defense of Salta first and foremost. Once the city is secured, agents should seek out Santino Romero and destroy any mech weaponry in his possession. This will not be easy as Romero moves constantly and is extremely paranoid. MASS pilots will be provided a support crew and equipment to convoy through the Andes as needed.

Mountain Defense Mech Encounter - Enemy mechs are en-route along a winding mountain road. The most defensible position in Salta is surrounded by multiple levels of elevation and a few small houses. Footing can be difficult due to patches of loose gravel. For a three player Encounter, field 2 Sweeper Mechs, 2 Commando Mechs, and 1 Sniper Mech. For four players, add 1 Gunner Mech and 3 Anti-Mech Infantry. For five players, add 1 Gunner  Mech and 3 Anti-Mech Infantry. And for 6 players, add 1 Assault Mech and 1 Veteran Mech.

After the defense of Salta, players will need to load up equipment and hit the road to track down Santino Romero, as he was not present for the attack on Salta. Most activity related to Permanent Midnight is to the South through the mountains. The roads are difficult to navigate and extremely dangerous.

Militia Roadblock Character Encounter - The convoy will be stopped by a landslide that has blocked the road. An armed militia wearing bandannas will approach the convoy. Their leader, Juanita Lima, will tell the convoy to go back the way it came and that foreigners aren’t welcome. Juanita is the only one to pull down their bandanna and reveal their face. She is surprisingly young with wild hair. Any attempt to convince the militia to allow the convoy to pass is a 2 difficulty. If a fight ensues, all combatants are Easy Opposition (D6). There are a number of them surrounding the convoy. Turning the convoy around and going back North will cause the negative outcome in the Destroyed Village Mech Encounter to trigger. If the militia can be convinced or defeated, the rocks and gravel that block the road will still need to be cleared. Clearing the road is a 2 difficulty task.

Gaining information on Permanent Midnight’s location is a 3 difficulty task that will require talking to the locals and investigating Romero’s trail. Players might stake-out villages that pay Romero for protection, encounter small collectives of citizens who have heard rumors, or investigate battlefields of previous engagements. Regardless of the success of their investigation, the MASS pilots eventually uncover that Romero is hunting a local militia which has been blocking roads and ambushing his trade routes. Failure to collect information means it takes longer to find Permanent Midnight’s location and will lead to the negative outcome in the Destroyed Village Mech Encounter. Either way, they’ll need to return to the area where they first encountered Juanita Lima and her militia.

Destroyed Village Mech Encounter - The trail leads to a small village that is in flames in the early morning hours. Fires burn in the agricultural fields. Smoke fills the air. The entrances to hives of advanced underground housing clusters have been wrecked. Santino Romero and his gang are nearly done destroying the village. If the negative outcome was triggered for this Encounter, players find Juanita Lima and her militia were killed while trying to defend their village. However, if the MASS pilots were able to get there in time, they find Juanita and her militia retreating towards them as they approach. For a three player Encounter, field The Challenger (Permanent Midnight), 2 Commando Mechs, and 4 Anti-Mech Infantry. For four players, add a Combat Mech and 3 Anti-Mech Infantry. For five players, add a Gunner Mech and 3 Helicopters. And for 6 players, add a Combat Mech and 3 Anti-Mech Infantry.

A press conference is being held at the Global Protectorate headquarters in Tokyo to commemorate the unveiling of the Horn of Gargoth. Gargoth was the last alien monster to be defeated. It’s death ended the alien invasion. The horn is encased in a statue in the courtyard of the Global Protectorate headquarters. The unveiling is meant to remind the world of the previous triumphs of humanity in these trying times.

The newly elected Defense Archon of the North American Defense Alliance (NADA), Julia Hayden, will also be speaking. Hayden is a passionate leader who is loved by much of NADA. She is an advocate for the nations that suffered the most during the alien invasion. Part of her political agenda is seeking aid from the international community to rebuild portions of NADA that are still in ruins. Hayden’s presence at the unveiling was requested by the GP as a show of good faith and cooperation.

MASS pilots will be asked to provide extra security during this public event. Many international leaders will be present and any incidents would look bad for the Global Protectorate. Julia Hayden will give a speech which starts off mundane. Eventually she will begin to criticize the Global Protectorate for hoarding research related to alien biology. Hayden will claim the GP uses this information to build war machines and maintain their political dominance around the globe. She will advocate for the free and open research of all alien technology and criticize the statue as an excessive show of the GP’s privileged position. As this rousing speech comes to an end, a gunshot will ring out from an assassination attempt.

Assassination Attempt Character Encounter - The Global Protectorate courtyard is lined with seating for honored guests. Journalists surround the square and the public has massed in the streets behind them. Enemy soldiers in plain clothes are mixed in with the public and there is a sniper positioned in an office window of a nearby building. Attempts to spot either before the assassination attempt are a 2 difficulty. Successfully spotting the threat allows someone to react a split second before the shot is fired. Failure to see the assassination attempt coming means that Julia Hayden is shot and needs immediate medical attention. Stabilizing her is a 2 difficulty task. There are multiple armed soldiers in the crowd (Easy Opposition D6) as well as the shooter in the office window (Tough Opposition D10). All of them will open fire and attempt to finish the job after the initial shot.

Once the would-be assassins have been dealt with, MASS is informed that terrorists calling themselves the Knights of Gar-goth are attacking the city. The Knights of Gargoth are known to worship the alien invaders as superior life forms, but this is the first time they’ve ever acted violently. Armed mechs are assaulting the Ginza shopping district in downtown Tokyo. A call to all MASS pilots to scramble and get there as quickly as possible goes out.

Shopping Center Mech Encounter - Terrorists have taken up a defensive position in a cluster of buildings in downtown Tokyo. Multiple tall buildings create narrow lanes to move and see through. For a three player Encounter, field 3 Gunner Mechs, 3 Artillery Mechs, and a Laser Mech. For a 4 player game, add 5 Anti-Mech Infantry. For a 5 Player game, add 1 Laser Mech and  1 Gunner Mech. And for a six player game, add 1 Artillery Mech and 3 Anti-Mech Infantry.

After the encounter, the MASS pilots will be told that the attack they’ve just dealt with was a distraction. The GP courtyard was attacked and the Horn of Gargoth was ripped from its cement encasing by a powerful mech that immediately fled afterward.

War has broken out. After the assassination attempt on Julia Hayden, the North American Defense Alliance has allied with the East Asian Confederacy. They have begun an assault against the Indo-Russian Coalition (IRC). All communications out of the city of Mumbai have gone silent. The EAC has assaulted the city and set up a Black Zone, an electronic barrier which prevents all communications from coming in and out of the city. One of the world’s foremost experts on alien technologies and a former ally of the Global Protectorate, Layla Zimmerman, was last seen in the city giving a lecture series at Mumbai University. It is imperative that Zimmerman is extracted before the city is under full occupation. The NADA army is currently marching on the city. MASS must get into Mumbai and get Professor Zimmerman out as soon as possible.

Campus Conflict Mech Encounter - A small IRC infantry unit under the command of Vishal Patel is currently out-gunned by an EAC battalion. They have fallen back to the university, but they are doomed without mech support. IRC soldiers have set up barricades in front of the university as well as soldiers on the large roof. MASS pilots arrive on the scene right before EAC infantry and mechs approach through the city streets surrounding the university. For a three player game, field 3 Tanks, 8 Anti-Mech Infantry, and 2 Gunner Mechs. For a four player game, add 1 Sweeper Mech and 2 Anti-Mech Infantry. For a five player game, add 1 Artillery Mech and 3 Anti-Mech Infantry. And for a six player game, add 5 Tanks.

After the fight, Patel will let the MASS pilots know that civilians from the university were directed to evacuate through the railways. It is the only form of transportation that hasn’t been shut off by the EAC. A trip to the train station will reveal Professor Zimmerman attempting to direct a group of frightened students. Professor Zimmerman will attempt to escape by train. If MASS accompanies her on this escape route, they’ll play through the train escape encounter.

Train Escape Character Encounter - A very crowded train takes an unnervingly long time to leave the station in Mumbai. After the train breaks out of the city and into the countryside, a NADA tank halts the train by stopping on the tracks in front of it. NADA soldiers are not concerned with civilians escaping Mumbai, but they are interested in capturing Professor Zimmerman. They demand everyone get off the train and check everyone’s credentials. Fooling NADA soldiers into believing that Zimmerman is someone else will be a 3 difficulty task under these circumstances. There are many armed soldiers (Easy Opposition D6) controlling the crowd as well as a gunner sitting atop the tank (Average Opposition D8). There is also a driver within the tank. The tank hatch is open at the beginning of the Encounter, but it is a 2 difficulty task to open it if closed.

Alternatively, Lieutenant Patel believes the source of the Black Zone transmission is a nearby communications facility. Destroying the transmitter would make an air evacuation possible and allow Patel to call for support to help defend the city.

Facility Infiltration Character Encounter - Lieutenant Vishal Patel initiates a frontal assault on the Black Zone facility in order to create a distraction. The MASS pilots have been tasked with infiltrating the facility using adjacent rooftops. Getting into the facility from the adjoining buildings is a 2 difficulty task, avoiding security is another 2 difficulty task, and navigating the locked doors and closed computer systems are both 3 difficulty tasks. Failures on any of these tasks could mean encounters with EAC soldiers (Average Opposition D8) or casualties in Lieutenant Patel’s frontal assault. The last remaining task is dismantling the Black Zone transmitter itself, which is a 1 difficulty task once security is bypassed.
Episode 5: A Lead in New Texas

Signs of the Knights of Gargoth have popped up in New Texas. Intel leads to the desert outside of El Paso. A war hero from the days of the alien invasion, Rick Douglas, is based out of El Paso. The MASS pilots should pay Douglas a visit to gather intel before heading out.

Rick is one of the pilots that took down Gargoth during the alien invasion. Douglas and the High Riders threatened to not participate in the battle unless Texas was promised independence afterward. Rick’s gambit payed off and now he’s a New Texas legend. Many view Rick as a traitor for putting the fate of the world on the line for political reasons. Rick can be found at the headquarters of his car dealership in El Paso. Douglas is old, proud, and generally dislikes the GP. But he is happy to swap war stories with pilots and soldiers. He’ll promise that there’s no terrorist activity in El Paso and offer to take the MASS pilots out on his land-yacht to survey the surrounding desert. During the trip the hovercraft will be attacked by the Knights of Gargoth.

Hovercraft Attack Character Encounter - From the deck of Rick Douglas’s luxurious land-yacht, MASS pilots can see the approach of a military-grade dropship in the desert skies. Knights of Gargoth hover-troopers (Average Opposition D8) fly from the dropship and assault Douglas’s hovercraft. The drop-ship itself (Tough Opposition D10) will also open fire on the yacht. If the troopers and dropship are neutralized, a mech will approach and shoot a missile which sends the hovercraft crashing. Everyone on-board is knocked-out in the crash. They wake up much later in captivity.

Jail Cell Character Encounter - The MASS pilots wake up in a damp and dirty cell fashioned from an old shipping container. There’s a door with a sliding view-port and three deadbolts. A hanging light-bulb in the center of the cell provides dim light. Prisoners are given food twice a day. Two guards, Ode and Jeb (Average Opposition D8), are the only contact they have until Broodmaster Yachtyl pays them a visit. Yachtyl is an intimidating woman with long, dark hair who will pull one pilot at a time from the cell to interrogate them. Resisting the pain and interrogation techniques is a 2 difficulty task. If unsuccessful, Yachtyl will resort to other means of interrogation. She has psychic powers that allow her to reach into people’s minds. It is a 2 difficulty task to resist this psychic assault.

Any attempts the players make to break-out of their jail cell is a 3 difficulty task, but Yachtyl’s interrogations should happen before they can enact their plan of escape. When players break out, they will find only a few guards (Average Opposition D8). They will also find Rick Douglas in a separate jail cell and will need to help him escape. The way out of the compound passes through a research room with vats of growing organisms covered in green tendrils. Most of the organisms appear to be dead. But one is in a clear cylinder and writhes against the glass as the MASS pilots walk nearby. Anyone who experienced Broodmaster Yachtyl’s psychic assault during their interrogation will recognize this bizarre organism reaching out into their minds ever so slightly.

There are also computer terminals in the research room which contain data on these strange organisms. These “Star Seeds” are alien in origin and can provide psychic abilities when they form a symbiotic relationship with a human host. The lab also has communication capabilities which will allow the pilots to contact MASS. Otherwise, they will have to make a trek through the desert to reach civilization. This is a 2 difficulty task and failure might mean Rick Douglas cannot make it. Once the MASS pilots escape and have a moment to regroup, they’re informed that the Knights of Gargoth are attempting to move this secret research facility. The MASS pilots are given a mission to stop the Knights of Gargoth from covering-up this underground facility.

Desert Assault Mech Encounter - The underground research facility is being dug-up by workers and machinery. The landscape has been wrecked by man-made craters and is littered with evacuation equipment. The same mech that attacked Rick Douglas’s land-yacht is overseeing the operation. The pilot of this mech is Broodmaster Yachtyl. For a three player game, field The Confronter (Broodmaster Yachtyl), 4 Helicopters, 2 Assault Mechs, and 1 Combat Mech. For a four player game, add 5 Anti-Mech Infantry. For a five player game, add 2 Combat Mechs and 1 Helicopter. And for a six player game, add 1 Assault Mech and 3 Anti-Mech Infantry.

The scientists at the Global Protectorate have uncovered that Broodmaster Yachtyl’s psychic powers come from an alien growth at the base of her neck. It appears to have a symbiotic relationship and matches the organisms growing in vats in the underground New Texas facility. But the nature of these creature’s biology is beyond their understanding. Professor Layla Zimmerman is the foremost expert on alien biology. Select MASS pilots have been assigned the task of delivering the living Star Seed to Zimmerman and convincing her to research it.

Layla Zimmerman and the Alaskan Initiative (AI) withdrew from the Global Protectorate in a show of pacifist rebellion. Alaska is home to many of the world’s foremost research centers. These labs were integral in developing much of the mech technology that allowed humans to defeat the alien invasion. After the invasion, they refused to participate in research which could contribute to violence.

Now, Layla Zimmerman operates a complex network of high-tech biodomes. This massive research facility has sprouted an entire village around it to support the infrastructure of her work. These facilities are used to research solutions for world hunger, environmental collapse, and disease.

Convincing Layla Zimmerman to cooperate with the GP and take on the task of researching the Star Seed will be a 2 difficulty task. If any pilots are present who participated in the Mumbai mission they will have Advantage. Even if Zimmerman refuses to research the Star Seed, the Alaskan Initiative will store it somewhere safe and allow the MASS pilots to stay the night. In the middle of the night, everyone in the facility experiences strange dreams with images of writhing growths and an intense feeling of festering hunger. An alarm sounds in the facility waking everyone up. Deranged research assistants have come out of the classified area and started attacking everyone in the facility.

Star Seed Character Encounter - Deranged scientists (Average Opposition D8) with blank eyes and foaming mouths have opened fire with pistols in the research hub that connects each biodome. They are clearly not acting under their own willpower and sparing their lives, if at all possible, would be ideal. However, they are a threat to everyone in the facility and have already shot a handful of people. They need to be subdued one way or another. Screams can be heard coming from the classified research lab and the security doors have been left open. Pressing into the facility will reveal the Star Seed floating in the middle of the room with scientists around it going crazy. Scientists in containment masks and sterilization suits (Average Opposition D8) are banging their heads against the wall and screaming. If they see anyone enter, they will attempt to lash out at them. If Layla Zimmerman agreed to research the Star Seed, then she are also present and attempting to fight off insanity.

Approaching the Star Seed itself triggers a vivid vision of the Space Angel Demon Dragon floating amongst the stars. A writhing mass of Star Seeds and other alien organisms are growing in its hive womb. Flashes of an alien home-world being immolated by an exploding sun and the feeling of searing heat strikes anyone who experiences this vision. An urge to thrive, to conquer, and to survive begins to consume anyone close to the Star Seed. It is a 2 difficulty task to resist this vision. The lab has capabilities to blast the Star Seed with extreme cold to neutralize it. The Star Seed can also be shot. However, approaching it further will cause intense feelings of hunger and rage.

After recovering from this vision, Layla Zimmerman recounts the alien’s thirst for our world. She hypothesizes that the previous alien invasion was a scouting party and that the image they saw was a growing invasion force. As everyone recovers, an alert goes off signaling an attack. An EAC mech squadron has crossed the Bering Strait to attack the Alaskan Initiative. The AI is defenseless and Layla Zimmerman will beg the MASS pilots to hold off the attack while the facility is evacuated.

Frozen Lake Mech Encounter - A large frozen lake stands between the MASS pilots and a mech squadron. The enemy units will attempt to go around the lake through a thick pine forest on one side. The lake itself it stable enough for mechs to walk on, but counts as Difficult Terrain. For a three player Encounter, field 4 Tanks, 2 Helicopters, 2 Laser Mechs, and a Veteran Mech. For four players, add a Veteran Mech and 2 Helicopters. For five players, add 2 Assault Mechs and 1 Tank. And for a six player game, add 2 Gunner Mechs and a Tank.

Professor Zimmerman has prepared a report on the vision witnessed in Alaska. Zimmerman wishes to present it to the Global Protectorate at their Council of States in Abu Dhabi. Zimmerman has requested MASS join her there as both protection and support for her report. The night before the Council of States starts, NADA attacks Abu Dhabi. They intend to destabilize the GP and kill off important leaders before they have a chance to collectively enter the war. The MASS pilots have been charged with setting up a defensive perimeter around the Etihad Towers to guard the political guests there for the Council of States.

Tower Defense Mech Encounter - The Etihad Towers are assaulted from all directions. The five towers form a small cluster and there are lower elevations which provide defensible positions. The surrounding area is open with a few trees and major roads. For a three player Encounter, field 2 Strike Mechs, 1 Sniper Mech, 2 Artillery Mechs, and 2 Helicopters. For Four Players, add 2 Combat Mechs and 1 Helicopter. For five players, add 1 Sniper Mech and 1 Assault Mech. And for six players, add 5 Anti-Mech Infantry.

After defending the towers, GP headquarters will let the MASS pilots know that Abu Dhabi security forces have been wiped out. NADA commandos have taken over the Emirates Palace hotel and have political hostages in the ballroom. The MASS pilots are the nearest potential agents available for a covert rescue mission. The assault on Abu Dhabi has largely failed, but these few remaining soldiers are attempting to barter their escape using the lives of important political figures as ransom.

Hostage Rescue Character Encounter - Hostages are being held at gunpoint by commandos. A frontal assault means the lives of these hostages will likely be lost. The hotel needs to be covertly infiltrated in order to take out the hostiles. Entering the grounds unseen and breaking in to the building itself are both 2 difficulty tasks. The front of the Emirates Palace has foot soldiers (Easy Opposition D6) watching the front steps. The interior ballroom has special forces commandos (Tough Opposition D10) surrounding several hostages sitting on the floor. There is a balcony above with foot soldiers (Easy Opposition D6). The room has entrances from multiple points, including the balcony. Any loud confrontation will likely draw the attention of the soldiers guarding the front stairs.

The next day, the Council of States will still proceed as scheduled. Professor Zimmerman will give a testimony regarding the Star Seed and MASS will be asked to provide a statement. If the hearing goes well, the Global Protectorate will pledge to stop continued aggression from NADA and the EAC.
Episode 8: Anarchy in the Old UK

The Knights of Gargoth have taken over a major UK TV network and Broodmaster Pheavus has broadcast a message to the world claiming that the aliens that invaded a generation ago were man-made bio-weapons. Pheavus claims that the Knights of Gargoth unleashed these fake “alien” monsters and that the Zimmerman Report is complete fabrication. Pheavus promises that the Knights of Gargoth will be proving their capabilities to build a massive bio-weapon very shortly.

A MASS team is sent to the UK to intercept the Knights of Gargoth. They are given vehicles and must race across London to catch Broodmaster Pheavus. Driving through London is a bitter reminder of how much the city suffered during the alien invasion. Many buildings still lay in ruins and major sections of the highway system have not been rebuilt. Many people who had the means to leave the UK have done so and the rebuilding effort has been extremely slow. BBC1, the only remaining broadcast network in London, has been hijacked by the Knights of Gargoth. They killed much of the local police force in the process. As the MASS team arrives at the station, the Knights of Gargoth pull away in three large SUVs.

Car Chase Character Encounter - The Knights of Gargoth attempt to lose the MASS team through the streets of London. It will be a 2 difficulty task to keep up. Two of the SUVs will actively try to run their pursuers off the road while the vehicle containing Broodmaster Pheavus will try to stay as far away as possible. Each SUV has armed soldiers (Easy Opposition D6) and a shoot-out is likely to erupt. If stopped, Broodmaster Pheavus (Tough Opposition D10) will join the battle and attempt to attack any pursuers with his psychic powers. Pheavus will specifically reference the coming alien invasion and thus contradict the statements he made on television. He says that the Knights of Gargoth will sow chaos and confusion and pray on human weakness. The Broodmaster says that the weakness of humans is their inability to work together and that they will never have the singularity of vision that the hive has. He believes this is why humanity is ultimately doomed and why intelligent people should abandon their human weakness and hope to ascend to a greater form.

When defeated, Broodmaster Pheevus will say that his human genes are weak, but that Chorgul will destroy the MASS pilots. At that point in time, the team will be alerted that a massive alien is attacking London along the River Thames. It appears to be Chorgul, one of the aliens that invaded Earth a generation ago.

Alien Attack Mech Encounter - Chorgul is a massive, alien monstrosity that is attacking buildings along the South Bank of the Thames river in the heart of London. Rubble and smoke fill the air. Chorgul topples a huge Ferris wheel which comes crashing to the ground as the MASS team approaches. Chor-gul appears to be under the control of the Knights of Gargoth who accompany it. For a three player Encounter, field an Otherworldly Being (Chorgul), 1 Helicopter, and 2 Gunner Mechs. For four players, add 2 Assault Mechs and 1 Helicopter. For five players, add 1 Gunner Mech and 3 Tanks. And, for six players, add 1 Assault Mech a 3 Helicopters.
Episode 9: A Night on the Town

Zulli Yao, a high-end mercenary contractor from the Ivory Coast, has contacted MASS about a suspicious dealer in town. Word is there is a woman aggressively seeking alien DNA on the black market. Zulli is renown for discretion, so if he’s reaching out to MASS, it must be a serious situation. Zulli suspects the dealer is affiliated with NADA. And, after the attack on London, he doesn’t want anything to do with alien DNA trafficking. MASS pilots should rendezvous with Zulli at the Golden Palm, a high-end resort with known connections to smugglers.

The West African Alliance (WAA) has experienced a booming economy due to many international businesses seeking safe places to operate. Rebuilding efforts and economic changes that were instituted post-invasion pushed major interests to seek new markets. The Ivory Coast is now the primary hub for international business. Major players can all be found here for legitimate and illegitimate ventures. A party erupts every night in the coastal town of San-Pédro and downtown sparkles in the evening as brightly as if the sun had never set.

Zulli is an agent for mercenary mech pilots who has been very successful. Zulli Yao is a well known name and anyone with a mercenary past would have crossed paths with him at some point. He provided contract pilots for MASS in the past, but the GP believes dealing with mercenaries to generally be too dangerous. However, despite having a tenuous relationship with the GP,  Zulli feels this situation is too serious to ignore.
Sabrina Haas is a NADA agent tasked with obtaining raw alien biology. She dresses lavishly and travels with fierce looking guards.

Covert Surveillance Character Encounter - Zulli will be waiting at a private balcony table overlooking the main floor of the Golden Palm. Below is a floor of tables seated to dinner, a crowded dance floor, and a full band packed onto a stage. Sabrina Haas (Tough Opposition D10) makes the rounds on the floor below and Zulli suggests that you stop whatever it is she’s up to. Sneaking closer to listen in on the conversations below will be a 2 difficulty task and failing will likely provoke an engagement with Sabrina’s bodyguards (Average Opposition D8). Successfully eavesdropping on the conversation will reveal that there’s a deal with a pharmaceutical firm that has significant amounts of preserved alien bio-matter. The exchange will happen at midnight on the boardwalk.

If the MASS pilots wait to confront Sabrina Haas on the boardwalk rather than at the Golden Palm, sneaking close to the deal will be a 2 difficulty task. Once the hand-off is made, Sabrina and her bodyguards will kill their business partners. If Sabrina and the NADA agents are ever engaged in a fight and things look dire, the guards will attempt to inject themselves with a bright green fluid that makes their muscles bulge out to monstrous proportions (upgrading them to Tough Opposition D10). If they are taken out before they have a chance to inject themselves, these vials of green fluid can be found on their person and have obvious traces of alien DNA.

If Sabrina is confronted or captured, it is a 3 difficulty task to get information from her. If coerced, Haas would reveal that a NADA scientist named Noel Anderson has harnessed the power of the alien biology. Sabrina confesses that Anderson created the alien Chorgul that attacked London and that Noel is the head of the Knights of Gargoth. Sabrina will also gladly let the MASS pilots know that a North American Defense Alliance mech squadron is lying in wait nearby to intervene should anything go wrong with the deal.

Boardwalk Bash Encounter - NADA forces unload from a ship anchored just off the coast. The sand and waves are tough to walk through, but there isn’t much cover on the boardwalk beside a few tall hotel buildings facing the beach. For a three player game, field 2 Bomber Mechs, a Veteran Mech, 2 Assault Mechs, and 1 Helicopters. For four players, add a Veteran Mech and 2 Helicopters. For five players, add 5 Anti-Mech Infantry. And for six players, add 2 Gunner Mechs and a Helicopter.
Episode 10: Fireworks on the Fourth of July

After gathering a small force of allies, the Global Protectorate is ready for an assault on Washington DC. The critical target is believed to be Noel Anderson. The extent of NADA’s knowledge related to alien technology is unknown. But all intel leads to a research facility deep within the Pentagon as the primary source. Neutralizing Anderson and destroying the research facility may be more important than stopping the war itself. A MASS squadron, dropped directly into the heart of the city, will be responsible for this surgical strike.

Monster Lord Mech Encounter - The MASS assault is immediately attacked by the NADA army. Soldiers will inject themselves with alien strength serum and Broodmaster Zornathar will control these monstrosities with the Star Seed implanted in her head. Anyone who participated in the Tokyo mission will recognize Zornathar’s mech as the one that stole the Horn of Gargoth. She wields the Horn of Gargoth like a massive sword. Zornathar admits that the Knights of Gargoth and Noel Anderson have been pulling strings in NADA in order to facilitate alien research and prepare the world for the coming alien invasion. Julia Hayden was a puppet that was becoming too powerful to control. For a three player Encounter, field The Commander (Brodmaster Zornathar) and 10 Alien Swarm Drones. For 4 players, add 2 Tanks and a Defender Mech. For five players, add 3 Helicopters and a Gunner Mech. And for six players, add 2 Tanks and a Defender Mech.

Final Confrontation Character Encounter - Entering the underground lab of Noel Anderson will require MASS pilots to get out of their mechs and venture into what feels like a living hive under the Pentagon. Noel Anderson’s body has morphed into a lanky monstrosity that’s covered in ooze and radiating intense heat. Anderson is nearly unconcerned with any disturbance. This transformed scientist is attempting to reach the Space Angel Demon Dragon to let it know that the Earth is ready to be invaded. Attempting to block his transmission is a 3 difficulty task due to its alien nature. Anderson (Elite Opposition D12) will lash out with long claws if anyone attempt to stop this transmission. Large alien-human hybrids (Tough Opposition D10) will unleash from the walls if Anderson’s wellbeing is threatened.

Once neutralized, Anderson will mention his last and greatest project. He says that his clones are perfect and unbeatable. Checking in with headquarters reveals that giant clones of the alien invaders have emerged and taken out much of the GP forces in Washington DC. They are currently on a rampage throughout the National Mall.

Alien Clone Mech Encounter - The Washington National Mall, all of the monuments, and the White House are in danger of being trampled by giant alien clones which are rampaging through the streets. For a three player Encounter, field a Thrashing Lizard (Gargoth) and 5 Alien Swarm Drones. For a four player Encounter, field a Thrashing Lizard and a Two-Headed Dragon. For a five player Encounter, field a Thrashing Lizard, a Two-Headed Dragon, and 5 Alien Swarm Drones. And, for a six player Encounter, field a Thrashing Lizard, a Two-Headed Dragon, and a Vicious Monstrosity.

That’s up to you! This is where the official campaign ends, but there’s plenty more going on in the world that needs the attention of MASS. After all, there’s about to be an alien invasion! We hope you’ll continue to play Beamswords and Bazookas and explore what might happen next. The story is all yours now!
